page.title: 11Scalford Bakery
page.content: Scalford Bakery is a small family business, started by George Allen in 1902, and passed on to each generation since. Now it is owned and run by two brothers, Charles Ernest and George Edward Allen.Charles' son Charles Anthony also works in the business, and George's wife Margery owns the bakery shop where some of the bread is sold. The Allens sell the rest of the bread by driving around the area up to a distance of 13km to the NE.On this run, deliveries include bread to Belvoir Castle for the Duke of Rutland. Types of bread baked are brown, white,granary, bloomers, tin loaves, steam loaves, and bread buns, as well as pork pies, cakes, biscuits and scones.
